newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss money market rates ease slightly.
newsitem.headline: Swiss money market rates ease slightly.

text.p: Swiss money market rates were seen slightly softer than on Friday, with overnight money quoted by one bank at 1-3/4 percent to 2.00 percent.
Traders said the market was calm in early trade, and they reported no special actions by the Swiss National Bank.
The SNB said last week it was continuing to add liquidity to the market after several other European central banks, including the Bundesbank, moved to lower money market rates.
On Friday morning, overnight money was quoted in a broad range between 2.00 to 2.25 percent.
